page.title: 10Maltby Sports Centre
page.content: Maltby Sports Centre was built in 1972.It was the last major project of the West Riding County Council before local government reorganisation.Since 1974 it has been run by Rotherham Metropolitan Borough Council.It was originally designed to accommodate swimming,squash,sports hall and gymnasium.However lack of finance has prevented completion of all facilities.The main swimming pool is 25m long and 12.5m wide and ranges in depth from 0.9m to 2m. Adjacent is a diving pool 3.8m deep,with spring and high diving boards.There is also a shallow pool for beginners to be taught how to swim. Other activities at the centre are Karate,Keep fit classes and table tennis.Sunday is the most popular day, with about 1000 people swimming and joining in activities.
